intro: Spuriopimpinella brachycarpa f. uchiyamana, commonly known as the Uchiyama's short-fruited spuriopimpinella, is a rare and specialized plant species native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant is distinguished by its compact growth habit and small, oval-shaped fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions with rich, humus-filled soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
